Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: crew347
Reviews.Content: This is a convenient hotel if you are between two flights in Mexico. Period. This Fiesta Inn is clean but is in need of some updating. Old bedding, carpets, etc.  24h airport shuttle is convenient. Booking office in the airport terminal. There isnt much around this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have you are on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: madera99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and was disappointed and underwhelmed by the entire stay. The hotel needs a complete renovation. The hotel room seemed dark, dirty and outdated. The bed is hard, the sheets and pillows seemed very old. The internet was spotty and unreliable. I seemed to always be disconnected and searching for a signal. Maid service showed up at 4pm the next day and not while I was away all day. I thought I didn't have hot water in the shower until I realized the hot and cold water faucets were reversed. the gym was small. The pool is an eyesore as its dirty and only 80% full of water. Overall- a total sub-par hotel that thinks its a three or four star. I would put this below a Motel 6 standard in the USA. On my last trip I stayed across the street at the Ramada. I was hoping this place would be a little nicer. On my next trip- I'll be headed to the Hilton or Camino Real.

Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Middelburg
Reviews.Content: Truth be told, after a long delay we were booked in this hotel by KLM. I was to tired to book a decent hotel myself. Extremely slow reception desk, grumpy staff. Rooms totally outdated and dirty as well. The smell was horrible because we were close to the garbage gathering place from the hotel...... Furthermore noisynrooms because of very thin walls and it feels you're sleeping next to the runway. Breakfast was sort of OK. My suggestion? Avoid if you can!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good to stay”
Reviews.Author: Luis K
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, what I expected from a Fiesta Inn, just the bathroom needs some upgrades but still clean. Is a nice place near the airport with a garden and a pool you might not notice that you are in a busy city near an airport. Shuttles will pick you up at gate 4 and take you to the hotel, but if it is late at night there will be no one or sign to tell you about it, you might have to wait for 15 or 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms need renovation and ONE rude employee!”
Reviews.Author: Lares1
Reviews.Content: Good location to the airport for a one night stay. Restaurant service and food was exellent! But the lady in concierge was very rude and not hospitable it all. When we made reservation we were told by her breakfast was included but when we got to the hotel the lady at the reception 'concierge' was so RUDE and told us bk was not included..her bad unappropiate attitude really set the tone for the one night stay we had. The rest of the staff was really nice though. Hotel was not worth paying $140 usd per night... Plus the towels were dirty and ripped in the room.

Reviews.Title: “a proper hotel for early morning”
Reviews.Author: Antoines
Reviews.Content: i pick this hotel as i need to take a flight at 5am in the mornig works perfect Decent room, i was located in the third room where gold member of fiesta rewards r meant to be with coffe and tea available for free and with more toiletries and amenitis in room at no cost. the gilr in the airport terminal 1 in the doo 4 i guess not pretty sure now the exacly door was incredible efficient and kind, her name was vanessa, congratulations vanessa you are a very nice host. a shuttle from hotel and to and from aiport teminals 1 and 2 is available 24hs for u to go and come as u want. also a subway station right in front of the hotel availeble for u. the hotel restaurant offer breakfast buffet for 180 pesos about 15 usd and dinner and luch buffet for 200 mexican pesos drinks inclusive.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 10 days, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: FARI_PTY
Reviews.Content: Stayed for several days because was attending a seminar nearby. Its close to Terminal 1, and in front of a Metro Station, this is a big plus to visit the city and elsewhere. The restaurant at the hotel is very nice, and you can go to Wings restaurant just next to the hotel, good steaks there. Free wifi but make sure to ask a room near the middle of the hallway, because a got a corner room and wifi signal was very weak. They have free shuttle to and from the airport, with regular service 24 hours. Good business center. Make sure to ask for a room at the first floor (rooms beginning with "2" or "3", I pick 1102 (first number is the level, 2nd number is the building, 3rd and 4th number is the room number) and there was a wedding on the weekend and kids were running all night long till 2am! Also ask for a room with a pool or garden view, one of my friends got a "parking lot view" (not nice). Rooms with a "2" on the second number (as 1220 for example) has this view. Overall a nice hotel and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever. Don't go there.”
Reviews.Author: Customer C
Reviews.Content: I arrived around 5AM at the hotel after a 9 hour flight. There was no room available. Normally this should have been my own fault but in this case I informed the hotel one week before my arrival and agreed to have one room available for an additional charge of 50$. After 5 minutes they found a room but when I entered the room it appeared to be occupied by a lady. After I made clear that I was about to leave the hotel they found another room. Strange isn't it? First there is no room and if you ask long enough there are two rooms? I call this lying, something you should never do to a customer. Later that day I complained to the manager on duty about this. She offered me a free dinner. Guess what, after the dinner they charged me for the drinks! She set the wrong expectations and now the customer has to pay for this. During a meeting with the area manager he mentioned to me that the way he sees it, it is all my own fault and the hotel does not owe me any apology. I decided to leave the hotel immediately. The manager choose to let me pay for the drinks and accepted the fact that four guests checked out 2 nights earlier. The worth of mouth damage is every worse. Not a smart deal but what can you expect from this hotel, right? Take my advise, go to the Holiday Inn a few blocks away with a shuttle bus to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a night”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizen21
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Mexico DF after an all night bus trip, this hotel was recommended by the taxi dispatch at the terminal. Check in was quick, a room was available in a few minutes, although it was mid-morning. The time waiting was spent by the helpful staff arranging a half day tour of the city for the following day that would drop me off at the bus station in time for my bus the following day. The rooms was comfortable, clean & had an Internet connection, which is important to me as I travel with my netbook. Location was not important to me as all I required a nice quiet place with restaurant where I could rest up for a night, between all night bus rides. All in all between the helpful staff, good selection of tasty food at reasonable prices suited my requirements to a T.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport, decent, but not great for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Don_Felipe_Chile
Reviews.Content: Granted, you pay a premium to stay close to the airport. The Fiesta was OK, a bit dated, could be cleaner. The area I was in had no elevator, so I had to drag luggage up the stairs. Internet was OK. Breakfast buffet was very nice, but $20USD. I stayed at the Ramada down the street on the return trip, which I got for the same price or a bit less. It was much nicer, cleaner, better service and the breakfast buffet was included, and it was better than the Fiesta Inn. Easy shuttle to and from the airport, with a little service desk in the airport terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: VORLOC
Reviews.Content: Its a nice clean place, near by Beniyo Juarez Intl Airport in Mexico DF. Good food and a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great for spending the night”
Reviews.Author: poty13
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night, a connection flight leaving next day. It's great if that's the only thing you want to do, because itÂ´s very close to the airport, specially with the traffic on D.F. this is a very good thing. Nice Rooms (big, clean). Great buffet. Nice pool. Free WiFi. If you want to visit the city, I wouldn't recommend it, since itÂ´s difficult to go out without a cab and thereÂ´s nothing near youÂ´ll want to see (just highways and the airport). Sometimes you can hear the planes. It wasn't very bad for me since it wasnÂ´t too much noise.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and plenty nice”
Reviews.Author: jojoishere
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel over a two week period while traveling through D.F. to other countries. We found its location to be perfect. It is a very quiet hotel considering how close it is to the airport. The staff could not be nicer. The beds are comfortable, nice TV's with ample channels to choose from. The shuttle is very reliable. They even took us out to pick some tacos for a small tip. There is not much in walking distance except a Wings next door (good food) and another hotel (Ramada I think). There are some small tiendas a couple blocks away. If you are not familiar walking streets of Mexico, best to stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only for a Layover”
Reviews.Author: etwasneues
Reviews.Content: This place falls solidly into the category of "good enough." The facilities have seen better days. But it was clean enough, quiet enough, close enough, etc. for a one night layover near the airport with an early flight. Basically, don't plan on spending a week here. The airport shuttle picks up at the Interjet door, and there's a woman there with a clipboard who can direct you. Internet is available in the business center. Posted fees are high, but I was not charged the first time, and only charge 50% the second time.

Reviews.Title: “good for what it's for”
Reviews.Author: ruditufino
Reviews.Content: very clean with first class food close to the airport with transportation available a little noisy but nothing major very secure place

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and comfortable stopover”
Reviews.Author: CambaNewZealand
Reviews.Content: This was a stopover after long haul flight NZ to LA, nightmare of LA airport and deadly queues/customs/transfer and bumpy flight to Mexico City. So I was well ready for some peace and rest! Pick up wasnt totally smooth. There is more than one exit gate and mine wasnt close to this point so wasted time as thought there would be a driver with name tag. Once I did find the pickup point I had to wait a while and there was nowhere to sit. The next day went more smoothly as the departure time was given the night before at the hotel desk. I was pleased with my room. It was away from the reception area and restaurant down a long corridor on the ground floor. It was spacious and comfortable with complimentary water and clean towels. I slept well, had an on time wake up call and wasnt disturbed by flight noise. One bonus was the swimming pool which I found very relaxing and a good way to stretch after the confines of planes. Internet access was available but not free. However was pleased to have the access in a quiet and private side area. I was too tired to use the restaurant at night so cannot comment and planned breakfast at the airport while awaiting onward flight. Only strange thing was that a local charity advertises in the room and asks for a very modest donation to be made at check out. I tried to make this but the check out had no idea what I was talking about even when I wrote the name of the charity on a piece of paper! I found this hotel fine for an overnight and felt comfortable and safe as a solo female traveller in her sixties.

Reviews.Title: “THE ROOM IS COLLAPSING”
Reviews.Author: kristhian
Reviews.Content: I stay one night in this hotel, the staff at the front desk is unfriendly the lady never smile, the bellboy do a very good job he is friendly and helpful, when enter to my room at nigh and close my door I can see that my room is collapsing in a side, I can see my door with a huge space between the door and the mark also de floor is slant I donâ€™t know is this is totally safe for their guest, also they donâ€™t provide a safety box in your, in general the hotel looks old. The only good thing is wifi internet in room works very well.

Reviews.Title: “3 rooms-- 3 with open doors--- 2 with NO FUNCTIONING LOCKS!”
Reviews.Author: JaneC-P
Reviews.Content: 1st room- sliding glass door loock would not function, both phones not functiong! 2nd room- deadbolt on door would not move, latch on door had been ripped out of door previously, and repair was evident. 3rd visit to front desk resulting in the manager provding me with a suite. Upon enterance with the assistant of the manager, one of the sliding glass doors again was not locked, and actually was open about 1 inch. This time the assistant locked the door. Deadbolt functioned as well. Overall, a disappointing performance from a chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over”
Reviews.Author: Lazzel
Reviews.Content: I just needed a clean, well located hotel near the airport for a quick stop over. This was a fantastic place. Loved it! The free shuttle was easy to find, the staff were fantastic and friendly. The hotel's bar was great. The room service was quick and tasty. As it was just a stop over I can't comment on location but great if you need a clean, quiet handy place to sleep whilst in transit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, safe & reliable bet for Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Omillett
Reviews.Content: Spent one night on a layover in Mexico City. We had arrived at the airport thinking we would not leave the airport, however flight delay made us change our mind. Went to the Fiesta Inn desk at the hotel, was assisted by a friendly clerk and given a reasonable rate including breakfast and transport. Transport to and from airport was speedy, efficient, friendly & clean. Hotel room was perfectly adequate and good value for an airport hotel. Comfortable beds, nicely appointed simple room, premium bathroom with a great shower. Exactly what one needs & expects from a moderately priced airport hotel property.

Reviews.Title: “It has seen better days.”
Reviews.Author: golfing10
Reviews.Content: Had to overnight in Mexico City in between connecting flights. check in OK. Room was a long way from elevators and window overlooked service area out back. Carpets in the hallways smell very musty. Bar service was good and food presentable. Overall this hotel has seen better days but is acceptable for overnighting. Shuttle service to T1 free.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have been.”
Reviews.Author: vdexoto
Reviews.Content: Fiesta INN aeropuerto is one of the best hotels I've been. I has everything I need - free internet, good food, good service, its clean its quiet, it has a desk on which you can work, comfortable bed. I has even an ironing board and an iron! There are about 15 quite big meeting halls. There is a pool and a fitness - free of charge for the hotel guests. You recieve a bottle of minral water every morning. For the once that watch TV there is a big TV in the room as well. Only one small drawback for me, but I am picky - its the towels, they are clean for sure, you can smell the detergen, but they are a little worn out. I would surely choose this hotel if I go to Mexico city again. Oh yes I forgot there is a free shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel - just go to gate 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NannaV
Reviews.Content: I was finishing a long week in Mexico. Flew into Monterrey, stayed in Saltillo, San Luis Potosi, Silao, Toluca and the last night across the street from the airport. Location is fantastic. The grounds are beautiful! The lobby is spacious and the restaraunt and bar inviting I had very high expectations for this hotel. I found my room and was dissapointed! The floor was very uneven and the bathroom floor was actually an inch or two higher like someone had poured the cement weird! I stumbled repeatedly. The sink had a black mold ring around it. The room was located next to the stairs and was very noisy. I asked if I could change rooms and was told no that the hotel was at capacity. It was late and I didn't want to go down to the restaraunt so I looked for a room service menu and couldn't find one. I called room service and asked for a menu they told me it was in the room and I told them it wasn't and I would like one. An hour later I went down to the restaraunt and picked one up. Service was prompt. I will stay here again but I will insist on a room away from the stairs and elevators. Breakfast buffet was excellent. The shuttle dropped me off at terminal two as requested and assisted me with my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyingfox007
Reviews.Content: Ideally located at the Mexico City airport. Transfer shuttle at gate 3 of the international section (terminal 1). Do not expect too much. Plus: Metro station directly in front of the door. Ask for it, as it is not visible from the entrance. For 2 Mex$ instead of 200 Mex$ to the Zocalo!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with qualifications”
Reviews.Author: Lalo_de_Mexico
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth or fifth time to stay at this hotel. Location, airport shuttle service, room, and food (!) are great. The breakfast buffet, which can be included with the room, is a synopsis of Mexican cooking. In addition, if you are comfortable taking the subway, you need only to walk across the street. The grounds are beautiful; in fact, we devoted our last morning in Mexico this time to the breakfast buffet and the hotel gardens. Sometimes, if I have a few hours at the Mexico City airport, I go to this hotel to eat. Preserve and be careful about your reservation. When we checked in, nothing we had done showed up electronically, although we had booked our room, breakfast included, on the Internet. I had to write everything again and ended up with the same price, I thought. Later, I realized I had received nothing at the desk to confirm that breakfast was included (no ticket, etc.). When I asked, the desk said all I had to do was give my room number to the restaurant. After the excellent breakfast, when we went to check out, I received a bill for the regular price of the room plus the normal cost of the buffet! I had my reservation number and confirmation, so I challenged them. The price came down more than $20. We paid about $103 U.S. for room and breakfast for two. On previous trips, sometimes without a reservation, I have paid $100 for single occupancy without breakfast. Either way, this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “VERY small rooms”
Reviews.Author: FrqTravlr
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers free airport transportation. It has a good restaurant and has spacious grounds. The biggest problem with the hotel is the room size. I get larger rooms with a basic room in NYC! The room decor is very old and the TV choices were poor. I used the internet with little problem and believe it was free. It may have been billed for it but I usually catch those type of charges. The last time I was in Mexico City I stayed at the Airport Camino Real. Given the cost difference between the two, I'll be staying at the Fiesta Inn next time even with the small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service - Never Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: irishkat
Reviews.Content: We had our most horrible hotel experience at Fiesta Inn (and we are very experience travelers). We had an overnight layover in Mexico City and choose this hotel due to its proximity to the airport and that it had shuttle service to the airport. When we got to Mexico City we called the hotel to say we were there and they said they would send the shuttle over. We stood outside at midnight for an hour waiting for the shuttle. During that hour all of the other hotel shuttles came two or three times. We called the hotel twice more during the hour and they kept telling us (lying to us) that the shuttle was on it's way. The hotel is only 5 minutes away. When the shuttle finally arrived and we reached the hotel, the staff was awful! I told them our situation and asked for a discount. I figured it was fair since they made us wait an hour and we were only staying for 5 hours. You can guess they said no, it was against their "policy". I guess it is also against their "policyâ€� to say sorry for the inconvenience or give any type of empathy. When I told them we didn't want to stay with that kind of service they told us that even if we didn't stay they would charge us for the room (again due to their "policy"). We ended up staying (as opposed to loosing a 130 bucks), neither of us sleeping well because we were so angry, and left early. I would never ever stay here. There are too many nice places and people to put up with awful service and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Getting old for the price”
Reviews.Author: curleydan
Reviews.Content: We wanted something simple for it was just one overnight. But the room had an oder, a moldy old carpet smell. We asked to be put in another room (the staff was not helpful), and it had the same smell. I was not trying to be crazy, for I have stayed in a lot of places, but at over $100/night, I expected more. Ultimately, we took the room, for it was late, then the A/C turned on, which was noisey. We tried to talk to the manager, but he would not come out of his office. Any awful hotel, and I would never recommond it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect entry into Mexico for lone female traveller”
Reviews.Author: tea_addict28
Reviews.Content: I don't know about the other people here, but I LOVED the Fiesta Inn Aeropuerto!!! I flew to Mexico City alone to go to a 2 week language school in Cuernavaca. I wanted to spend my first night in a hotel before moving on to stay with a family for two weeks. I felt I needed the extra time to adjust to being in Mexico and get oriented. I had never been to Mexico before. The Fiesta Inn Aeropuerto shuttle was a welcome sight, as I had heard that some taxis can be dangerous. When I arrived at the hotelat around 11 pm, staff helped me with my luggage. The mood in the lobby was exciting and festive; some sort of jazz was eminating from the hotel lounge, and there was much activity around. My room was quiet, clean and adequate; it was your typical American style hotel room. It had everything I needed to feel comfortable. The hotel restaurant has a buffet for all 3 meals. Yes, it is more expensive than eating from a street vendor, but it is very nice after a day of flying to be able to fill your plate yourself with a whole bunch of stuff, from salads and fruits, to Mexican specialities, to more familiar fare. I enjoyed my stay so much that I arranged to stay here my last night in country, in order to avoid stress the next morning on the way to the airport. I highly recommend this place and would stay here again, no problem!!!

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Bodeen72
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to save $$ compared to the airport Hilton. The hotel was about as expected. Perfect for what we needed, a one night stand. On arrival we found the shuttle with little problem, and the next day the driver dropped us off very near the departing bus to Puebla. If we had to do it over gain, we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be Conned!”
Reviews.Author: chuckandmary
Reviews.Content: Be very careful of the staff of this hotel if you arrive at the Mexico City Airport and are looking for overnight accommodations. The hotel agent (the one holding the Fiesta Inn sign at the airport exit) will quote you a price in writing in order to get you to take their van to the hotel, however once you arrive; the staff won't honor this price. They wonâ€™t even acknowledge that their agent made a mistakeâ€¦ we assume they think youâ€™ll stay and pay a higher room rate. We didnâ€™t and returned to the airport to find another hotel. Donâ€™t get caught up in Fiesta Innâ€™s con game!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your valuables”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel the last night we stayed in Mexico City because of the proximity to the airport. We were charged $180 USD with tax. The prices were outrageous for dinner in the hotel restaurant. It was empty for dinner as there is a Wings Restaurant around the block and it was packed. We were easy targets for someone coming in and stealing my jewellry case which contained costume jewels and some silver bought in Mexico. We arrived in the morning and left our bags unpacked as the taxi driver was waiting to take us out. We were gone for 6 hours and when we came back, my things were missing. Later that evening, we went out to dinner and when we returned, we found a catalog for porn available on the bed. This indicated to me that staff could come and go at will and the theft was an inside job. I did not report anything. It would have been a waste of time, I thought. Staff was distant and uncaring enough when we checked in. Mexico City was a friendly and safe city, but we were warned about unsafe neighborhoods. We did not have any problems, except this last incident. The airport area probably should be avoided, or take valuables with you when you go out or leave in hotel safe.

Reviews.Title: “F Y I”
Reviews.Author: Miguel-Mex
Reviews.Content: I forgot to mention that the PICTURES posted at the top DO NOT BELONG to the HOTEL AEROPUERTO. The pictures posted are from the hotel FIESTA INN AEROPUERTO (before its remodeling). Confusions may be possible because of the name AEROPUERTO, but this is, on my best, the info of the hotels: HOTEL AEROPUERTO - Boulevard Puerto Aereo 380 (THIS is the one we are talking about) HOTEL JR PLAZA AEROPUERTO - Boulevard Puerto Aereo 390 (this is about $80/$90 per room/night) HOTEL FIESTA INN AEROPUERTO - Boulevard Puerto Aereo 502 (very small rooms between $80/$90) HOTEL CAMINO REAL AEROPUERTO - Puerto Mexico 80 (avg. rate of $150, has changed names many times; you will pay for the name and because is "the only hotel with airport"; I stayed there when it belonged to a different chain and not a big deal; stay there if you find a supersaver web rate and let me know! )
